(2024). khroma: Colour Schemes Scientific Data Visualization. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1472077 https://github.com/jrnold/ggthemes https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RColorBrewer/index.html https://colorbrewer2.org/

code: findPCs(   seurat_object,   threshold_pct = 5,   threshold_cum_pct = 90,   threshold_diff_pct = 0.1,   elbow_plot = FALSE )

title: Determine the number of PCs to use for downstream analysis — findPCs
text: seurat_object Seurat object threshold_pct Threshold percent variation associated PC threshold_cum_pct Threshold cumulative percent variation associated PC threshold_diff_pct Threshold difference variation PC subsequent PC elbow_plot Logical value determine elbow plot generated

title: Determine the number of PCs to use for downstream analysis — findPCs
text: Number PCs use downstream analysis

title: Determine the number of PCs to use for downstream analysis — findPCs
code: if (FALSE) { findPCs(seurat_object,         threshold_pct = 5,         threshold_cum_pct = 90,         threshold_diff_pct = 0.1,         elbow_plot=TRUE) }

title: My personal ggplot2 theme — personalTheme
text: function sets custom ggplot2 theme styling plots consistently. provides options customize various theme elements, including size axis text, size plot title, position legend, . currently work progress.

title: My personal ggplot2 theme — personalTheme
code: personalTheme(   theme_type = "bw",   theme_bs = 16,   ax_title = 1.25,   ax_text = 1,   plt_title = 2,   x_angle = 0,   x_hjust = 0.5,   x_vjust = 1,   striptext = NULL,   legend_pos = "right",   legend_keytype = "point",   legend_title = 1.25,   legend_text = 1.25,   legend_keysize = 0.75,   guide_color = 4,   guide_fill = 4,   nopanels = TRUE )

title: My personal ggplot2 theme — personalTheme
text: theme_type Character string specifying base theme use. Options "bw" (default) "classic". theme_bs Numeric value specifying base font size theme. ax_title Numeric value specifying relative size axis titles. ax_text Numeric value specifying relative size axis text. plt_title Numeric value specifying relative size plot titles. x_angle Numeric value specifying angle x-axis text. x_hjust Numeric value specifying horizontal justification x-axis text. x_vjust Numeric value specifying vertical justification x-axis text. striptext Character string specifying strip text customize. Options "x", "y", "right". legend_pos Character string specifying position legend. Options "left", "right", "top", "bottom", "none". legend_keytype Character string specifying type legend key. Options "point" (default) "fillbar". legend_title Numeric value specifying relative size legend titles. legend_text Numeric value specifying relative size legend text. legend_keysize Numeric value specifying size legend key "fillbar". guide_color Numeric value specifying size color guide. guide_fill Numeric value specifying size fill guide. nopanels Logical value specifying whether remove grid panels plot.

title: My personal ggplot2 theme — personalTheme
text: list containing custom theme guide settings ggplot2.

title: My personal ggplot2 theme — personalTheme
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a custom theme with black and white color scheme my_theme <- personalTheme(theme_type = "bw", theme_bs = 16, ax_title = 1.25,                            ax_text = 1, plt_title = 2, x_angle = 0, x_hjust = 0.5,                            x_vjust = 1, striptext = "x", legend_pos = "right",                            legend_keytype = "point", legend_title = 1.25,                            legend_text = 1.25, legend_keysize = 0.75,                            guide_color = 4, guide_fill = 4) }

what: Plot slingshot lineages on UMAP — plotLineage
title: Plot slingshot lineages on UMAP — plotLineage
text: Plot slingshot lineages UMAP

title: Plot slingshot lineages on UMAP — plotLineage
Plot slingshot lineages on UMAP — plotLineage
text: pt_lin pseudotime column plot curves slingshot curves plot add_lineage Add lineage paths plot

title: Plot slingshot lineages on UMAP — plotLineage
text: ggplot object

title: Plot slingshot lineages on UMAP — plotLineage
code: if (FALSE) {  pseudotime_df <- scGrabbag::extractSlinghot(sds) df <- cbind(df, pseudotime_df) pt_lineages <- grep("PT", names(df), value = T) n_lineages <- length(pt_lineages)  # Use purrr to generate plots for each PT column plot_list <- purrr::map(pt_lineages, ~plotLineage(.x, curves, add_lineage = TRUE)) cowplot::plot_grid(plotlist = plot_list, align = 'v') }
